From Hong Kong movement's perspective, we support any protest that go against authoritarian. This would align our goal for fighting for Hong Kong.

However, the Catalan independence involves a homogeneous group that wants to separate from Spain when there do not seem to have clear oppression from the Spanish government. Having said that, grievances, like what we experience in Hong Kong, would start to escalate and lead to call for independence, which is not similar to Hong Kong as we do not ask for independence.

These are what I would suggest

DO NOT openly support or criticize Catalan independence as this will distract our own movement
DO criticize government/police violence against civilian as any dispute should be resolved through dialogues, in particular when there is a clear imbalance of power
RESPECT the choice of the people and the EU to mediate the conflict as the EU is a respectable entity to help resolve the issue.
